verdict.summary: Network timeout during package download from PyPI. Caused by slow connections, network congestion, large packages, or restrictive firewall/proxy settings. The default timeout of 15 seconds is often insufficient.

dead_ends.action: Simply retry the same command immediately
dead_ends.why_fails: If the network issue is persistent (slow connection, firewall), retrying without changes will hit the same timeout

dead_ends.action: Switch to HTTP instead of HTTPS to reduce overhead
dead_ends.why_fails: PyPI requires HTTPS; HTTP is blocked and also insecure

workarounds.action: Use a closer PyPI mirror or CDN
workarounds.how: pip install -i https://pypi.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/simple/ <package>  # or other regional mirror
workarounds.condition: when geographically far from default PyPI CDN

workarounds.action: Download the wheel separately and install from file
workarounds.condition: for large packages on slow connections

leads_to.condition: when timeout is caused by proxy misconfiguration

preceded_by.condition: when SSL handshake takes too long and times out

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Timeout is about the connection being too slow or dropping; proxy error is specifically about inability to connect through a proxy server
